main event: An airman and his wife, along with neighbors, observed a reddish-orange light in the sky over St. George, Bermuda, on September 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object moved slowly up and down and was stationary at times,The size of the object was compared to that of a grapefruit,The color of the object faded at times,The airman reported the sighting to Bermuda Air Traffic Control, which had no records of any aircraft in the area at that time,Another observer from the Kindley Control Tower reported seeing the same phenomenon shortly after.
witnesses: an airman, his wife, neighbors, and a staff sergeant
